marklogic.body:
Oh god, so much of this was me. SO MUCH. I started smoking at twelve and fell in love instantly. By 13 I was a smoker and by 16 I was smoking about 15-20 a day. My mum was NOT cool with it until I turned 18, when she realised she couldn't stop me. I smoked at all times: drinking, in the car, after food, after, before and often during sex. I would be halfway through a ciggarette and I'd think about lighting another. One cigarette at a time was not enough for me. Having a conversation was another big instigator of my smoking. Or being on the phone. I loved to chainsmoke and talk.
I loved, loved, loved smoking. It was a part of me, you know. I was miss_dot and I smoked. A lot. Those were the two most true things about me.
But... At the age of 26 I started getting Chest pains. Bad ones. I would get Puffed rolling over in bed. I couldn't exercise at all. I could see where it was taking me and if I kept at it, how it was going to kill me. I was 26 and I KNEW smoking was going to kill me.
So I started trying to quit then, and after a few disaterous attempts, I am now (about to be) 30 and I haveÂ been free of that nasty shit for 7 months. In that time I have lost 14 kilos and become addicted to kickboxing. I replaced one addiction with another, but this one is a good one. Now, whenever I feel the slight creeping of a craving, I think, 'do I want to be a well-muscled Muay Thai machine, or do I want to smoke?' The answer is pretty easy for me.
I quit Cold turkey. It's the best way for me. I also read the quit smoking bible: Allen Carr's Easy Way to Quit Smoking. I credit that book with saving my life, really.
